subclassFeature.name: Iceborn
entries: {@i 1st-level Iceborn feature}

Born from wastes made of ice and snow, your ancestors come from the faraway tundras. From the deep Abyss to the 5th layer of the Nine Hells, Stygia, your heritage can range from primordial beings of ice to even the most fiendish creatures. Your powers can also be gifts from these same otherworldly beings. Gods and Goddesses of Winter, such as Auril, are also prime candidates for the origin of these powers. Consult the Iceborn Origins table, or work with your DM on where your ice magic stems from.

entries.caption: Iceborn Origins
rows: You were born in a frozen wasteland, void of any other life except the ones who birthed you and other creatures that could withstand the frozen climate. Frost naturally builds up on your body even in extremely hot environments.

You were granted a boon of magic from the god/goddess of winter, giving you control over the very foundation of cryomancy. This boon grants you similar traits to that of an aasimar, including glowing eyes or even an icey halo.

One of or both of your parents were devils from the 5th level of hell, Stygia, giving you a natural connection to the magic found in the frigid climate, causing your skin to be naturally paler than what’s common from your race.

A White or Silver dragon is a long distant ancestor of yours, giving you various magical traits. Your teeth and fingernails are naturally sharper than what’s common for your race, but not enough to grant any physical improvement. You may even have lingering draconic scales.
An ice elemental gifted a relative of yours a magical boon. Snow slowly emits off your body and instantly melts when it hits the ground.
You were birthed or branded by a Demon from the Abyss. You have a magical brand on your body that is cold to the touch. Your skin surrounding the mark is frostbitten, but no pain can be felt from it.

subclassFeature.name: Cryomancy Magic
entries: Your magic comes from the frozen wastes, giving you the ability to always keep a cool head and give your enemies the cold shoulder. You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Cryomancy Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a {@filter conjuration or transmutation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|school=C,T|level=1;2;3;4;5} and if it deals damage, you must choose a spell that deals either cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, or necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Frozen Ancestry
entries: {@i 1st-level Iceborn feature}

Given your origins, you become accustomed to the creatures of your ancestry. Choose one of the following languages: Abyssal, Infernal, or Primordial. You learn to speak, read, and write the language you chose.

In addition, you have an innate ice magic that flows within you. You learn the {@spell Frostbite|XGE} cantrip and it does not count against your total number of known cantrips. If you already have this cantrip, choose one from: {@spell gust|XGE}, {@spell mending}, {@spell prestidigitation}, {@spell ray of frost}, or {@spell shape water|XGE}. You learn that cantrip instead.

subclassFeature.name: Iceborn Guide
entries: {@i 6th-level Iceborn feature}

Your heritage gives you an innate ability to push through the harsh environments of frozen wastes which allows you to make traversing these areas easier for you and your allies. You have resistance to cold damage and ignore the effects of extreme cold.

In addition, you ignore difficult terrain created by ice or snow and are not impeded by harsh environments in tundras or similar wastes. By spending 10 minutes you can magically provide this benefit to a number of allies of your choice equal to twice your proficiency bonus. This benefit lasts until the next time you finish a long rest. Creatures who gain this benefit do not gain your resistance to cold damage, but they do have advantage on saving throws made to resist the effects of extreme cold.

subclassFeature.name: Frigid Winds
entries: {@i 6th-level Iceborn feature}

Whenever you start casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage, icy winds blow out from you. This icy wind causes creatures of your choice that you can see within 20 feet of you to take cold damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Frostbiting Mark
entries: {@i 14th-level Iceborn feature}

When a creature fails a saving throw against one of your 1st level or higher spells that deals cold damage, you can mark that creature with a chilling brand. While marked with this brand, ice and frost slowly creeps into their body, granting them vulnerability to all damage until the end of your next turn. This renders any resistance or immunities they had useless until the effect fades. Once they next take damage after being marked, the frozen brand melts away, ending the effect. A creature is immune to the effects of this mark if they have resistance or immunity to cold damage.

You can only mark one creature at a time using this feature, and you can only mark creatures with this special brand a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all spent uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Frozen Soul
entries: {@i 18th-level Iceborn feature}

Your mastery over cryomancy permanently changes your very being as you become one with your ancestry. You have immunity to cold damage and learn the Investiture of Ice spell. If you already knew the {@spell Investiture of Ice|XGE} spell, you can choose another spell from the sorcerer spell list to learn instead. This spell does not count against your total number of sorcerer spells and you can cast it once at its lowest level without expending a spell slot.
Casting {@spell Investiture of Ice|XGE} in this way does not require concentration and lasts up to an hour rather than its normal duration of 10 minutes.

Whenever you cast {@spell Investiture of Ice|XGE} using a spell slot, its range becomes touch instead of self and you can target other creatures with the spell. Casting the spell at higher levels allows you to target one additional creature per spell slot level above 6th.

subclassFeature.name: Extraplanar Summoner
entries: {@i 1st-level Extraplanar Summoner feature}

Born with a connection to planar magic, sorcerers of this origin are capable of summoning creatures of varying origins. Aberrations, celestials, constructs, fey, fiends, monstrosities, and even undead creatures can be conjured by these odd spellcasters. Your innate magic comes from the other planes, such as the feywild, shadowfell, the outer planes such as the abyss, nine hells, or even mount celestia.

Extraplanar summoners are extremely handy to have due to the powerful allies they can conjure, however they are tied directly to you, so keeping yourself alive is just as important as keeping your ally healthy.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner Magic
entries: Your magic comes from the planes outside the material one, granting you powerful conjuration magic. You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Extraplanar Summoner Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a {@filter conjuration spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|school=C|level=1;2;3;4;5}.

subclassFeature.name: Extraplanar Ally
entries: {@i 1st-level Extraplanar Summoner feature}

As an action, you bind another creature’s soul from another plane to your whim and place it within a body you magically conjure. Choose one of the following creature types: aberration, celestial, construct, elemental, fey, fiend, monstrosity, or undead. Depending on the creature type you chose, use the corresponding Extraplanar Ally stat block. The creature obeys your commands and is friendly to you and your allies. It shares your initiative but moves and takes actions either right before or after your turn.
In addition to summoning the creature, you gain a magical benefit depending on the creature type you chose. You gain one of the following benefits until the Extraplanar Ally is destroyed:

entries.name: Aberration
entries: You gain the ability to speak telepathically to creatures you can see within 60 ft of you. In addition, you can reach into the minds of other creatures and cripple them. You can cast the {@spell Vicious Mockery} cantrip as if it were a sorcerer spell for you.

entries.name: Celestial
entries: You gain resistance to radiant damage and can spend your bonus action to heal a creature within 30 ft of you a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Construct
entries: You gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage and as a bonus action you can change the damage type of your next spell to force damage until the end of your next turn. You concentrate on this effect as if you were concentrating on a spell.

entries.name: Elemental
entries: Choose fire, water, earth, or air. In the Extraplanar Ally (Elemental) statblock you use the features corresponding to the chosen type. You gain resistance to poison damage and have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

entries.name: Fey
entries: You gain resistance to psychic damage and you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage you can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 60 feet.

entries.name: Monstrosity
entries: You gain a natural weapon in the form of claws or fangs. These natural weapons use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of strength or dexterity for its attack and damage rolls and deal 1d6 slashing or piercing damage (your choice). In addition your armor class increases by half your proficiency bonus (rounded up).

entries.name: Undead
entries: You gain resistance to necrotic damage and whenever you deal damage with a spell you can add an additional amount of necrotic damage to the spell equal to your proficiency bonus.

Your Extraplanar Ally is destroyed after a number of hours equal to twice your proficiency bonus, when it is reduced to 0 hit points, or if it is successfully banished via the Banishment spell, or other similar effect. When it is destroyed, its soul returns to its home plane. It retains no memories from when it was traveling with you while on its home plane and when it is summoned again it regains the lost memories. After your Extraplanar Ally is destroyed, you cannot summon it again until you finish a long rest.

You cannot have more than one Extraplanar Ally at any given time. You can dismiss your Extraplanar Ally as an action, or freely during a short or long rest. Once you dismiss your Extraplanar Ally, you cannot summon a new one until you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner Savant
entries: {@i 6th-level Extraplanar Summoner feature}

When you cast a conjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose to ignore the material cost of the spell. When you do so, you must use an arcane focus but it does not get consumed by the spell.
You use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Synergist
entries: {@i 6th-level Extraplanar Summoner feature}

Your Extraplanar Ally adds your proficiency bonus to its damage rolls for its weapon attacks. Your Extraplanar’s attacks are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming non-magical resistances. In addition, the benefit you gain from your Extraplanar Ally feature gets improved based on the creature type, the following changes (or additions) are made to said benefit:

entries.name: Aberration
entries: You add an additional amount of psychic damage to {@spell Vicious Mockery|PHB} equal to your proficiency bonus and your telepathy’s range increases to 120 ft.

entries.name: Celestial
entries: When you heal a creature using the benefit you gain from your Extraplanar Ally feature, you can spend sorcery points up to your proficiency bonus to add 1d4 healing per sorcery point spent.

entries.name: Construct
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being paralyzed.

entries.name: Elemental
entries: You have immunity to poison damage instead of resistance.

entries.name: Fey
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: You can see normally in darkness, magical or nonmagical, to a range of 120 ft instead of 60ft.

entries.name: Monstrosity
entries: Your speed increases by 15 ft and you gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus when you gain this feature, finish a long rest, or summon your Extraplanar Ally as a monstrosity.

entries.name: Undead
entries: When you hit a creature with a spell, you can spend 2 sorcery points to make that creature unable to gain the benefits of healing until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Combative Ally
entries: {@i 14th-level Extraplanar Summoner feature}
Your Extraplanar Ally gets multiattack, allowing it to make up to two attacks instead of one when it takes the attack action.

In addition, as a bonus action on your turn you can spend a sorcery point to give a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus to your Extraplanar Ally if it is within 60 ft of you.

subclassFeature.name: Extraplanar Master
entries: {@i 18th-level Extraplanar Summoner feature}

You can summon an Extraplanar Ally two times instead of once before you have to finish a long rest if it is destroyed or dismissed, but you can still only have one summoned Extraplanar Ally at any given time.

In addition when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, your Extraplanar Ally receives an amount of healing equal to the spell's level plus your proficiency bonus. This healing bypasses its Constructed Body feature.
Your Extraplanar Ally, and creatures you summon using a Conjuration spell of 1st level or higher gain an amount of temporary hit points when they are summoned equal to your sorcerer level.

trait.name: Constructed Body
entries: Due to its magically constructed nature, the body of the Extraplanar Ally is not the same as the summoned creature. As a result, it cannot gain the benefits of healing and it may not retain the ordinary attributes, resistances, or special senses a creature of the chosen variety might have. When the Extraplanar Ally is reduced to 0 hit points, the body bursts into harmless flames and is destroyed.

The constructed body can take any appearance, so long as it is similar enough to the chosen creature type. Typically, you'd want to make a body that best befits the chosen creature and to accommodate for its typical attacks and abilities.
The Extraplanar Ally uses your proficiency bonus in place of its own.

trait.name: Specialized Expertise
entries: Choose two skill proficiencies for the Extraplanar Ally to have. The Extraplanar Ally adds double your proficiency bonus to any ability checks using the chosen skills.

trait.name: Specialized Attributes
entries: For its attack and damage rolls, it uses either Strength or Dexterity. The ability scores chosen for the Extraplanar Ally are interchangeable, but are defaultly set to the recommended areas. You choose two saving throws, the Extraplanar Ally adds your proficiency bonus to those chosen saves.

trait.name: Spellbound
entries: Whenever you cast a spell, you can cast that spell originating from your Extraplanar Ally's position instead. If the spell has a range of self, it affects your Extraplanar Ally instead of yourself if you cast it from your Extraplanar Ally's position.

trait.name: Variable Trait
entries: Choose one of the following benefits for the Extraplanar Ally to have (at level 10 you pick two benefits):
{@b Winged} - it gains a flying speed of 40 ft.
{@b Aquatic} - it gains a swimming speed of 40 ft. and can breathe in both air and water.
{@b Spiked} - creatures that make melee weapon attacks against it while within 5ft of it takes piercing damage equal to PB.
{@b Siege Monster} - it always scores a critical hit on objects.
{@b Tough Body} - it has an additional number of maximum hit points equal to two times your PB.
{@b Durable Body} - it gains a bonus to its AC equal to its constitution modifier.
{@b Tail Attack} - it gains a tail attack, which it can use as a bonus action to make an additional attack when it takes the attack action.

trait.name: Specialized Expertise
entries: Choose two skill proficiencies for the Extraplanar Ally to have. The Extraplanar Ally adds double your proficiency bonus to any ability checks using the chosen skills.

trait.name: Specialized Attributes
entries: For its attack and damage rolls, it uses either Strength or Dexterity. The ability scores chosen for the Extraplanar Ally are interchangeable, but are defaultly set to the recommended areas. You choose two saving throws, the Extraplanar Ally adds your proficiency bonus to those chosen saves.

trait.name: Spellbound
entries: Whenever you cast a spell, you can cast that spell originating from your Extraplanar Ally's position instead. If the spell has a range of self, it affects your Extraplanar Ally instead of yourself if you cast it from your Extraplanar Ally's position.

trait.name: Variable Trait
entries: Choose one of the following benefits for the Extraplanar Ally to have (at level 10 you pick two benefits):
{@b Undead Fortitude} - it gains the undead fortitude trait, see the {@creature Zombie|MM} statblock from the Monster Manual for details.

{@b Regeneration} - it gains the regeneration trait, see the {@creature Vampire|MM} from the Monster Manual for details. If it takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the extraplanar ally's next turn. This healing bypasses its Constructed Body trait.
{@b Spectral Form} - it gains a flying speed of 30 ft and can hover. In addition it gains the incorporeal movement trait. See the {@creature Ghost|MM} statblock from the Monster Manual for details.
{@b Shadowy Form} - it gains the amorphous trait (see {@creature Shadow|MM} from the Monster Manual for details.) and can hide as a bonus action while in dim light or darkness.
{@b Undead Resistance} - it gains resistance to fire, cold, and lightning damage; and it also gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
{@b Chilling Touch} - when it uses its Life Drain attack, that target cannot gain the benefits of healing until the start of the extraplanar ally's next turn.
{@b Absorb Life} - when it uses its Life Drain attack, it regains hit points equal to the amount of damage it dealt to the creature. This healing bypasses its Constructed Body trait.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) necrotic damage.
